project.name: Monospatial
project.description:
Typographic letters serve as familiar means of communication. However, when they appear outside of text, a new way of seeing emerges—the familiar alphabetic lines and curves of text create an architectural structure. This transformation notwithstanding, the characters in Monospatial retain inherent familiarity, tempting viewers to search for recognizable sentiments, which they can sometimes find. Within this generative system that prioritizes form, functional aspects like legibility, recognizability, and pronounceability linger.

Monospatial originated as a system of manually drawn monospace letters. Each letter was initially given equal width and then programmed to undergo significant warping while preserving certain formal ratios and geometry.

The compositions draw inspiration from childhood days spent learning handwriting. Many of the pieces incorporate thin ruled paper lines, and the color palettes evoke print paper, No. 2 pencils, and retro schoolhouse furniture. When children trace and copy capital letters, it is often the only time in their education when they can appreciate the formal beauty of something as ancient as text.

Pixelated textures place Monospatial firmly in the digital, while also alluding to the analog texture of pencil marks.

The basic shapes of squares and circles are used to accentuate the geometry of the alphabet. These shapes establish connections throughout the compositions, highlighting and disrupting the familiar rigidity of text on a page.

project.name: Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags: A Personal Synthesis of Protection and Timeless Style
project.description:
Step into a world where resilience and artistry intertwine, where the essence of protective hairstyles converge with the timeless elegance of the humble du-rag. In this groundbreaking art project, titled Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags, I, as a Black man and artist, invite you to join me on a transformative exploration of culture, self-expression, and the enduring allure of classic style.

Immerse yourself in a tapestry of innovation as I pave the way for the first-ever on-chain generative art project featuring braids and locs. By merging the power of generative code with the rich heritage of these hairstyles, each cascading braid and meticulously crafted loc emerges as a vibrant homage to the intricate art of hair protection.

Within this digital landscape, Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags transcends the boundaries of traditional mediums, leaving an indelible mark in the world of art and technology. It celebrates the timeless relationship between style and functionality, where du-rags become essential accessories in preserving the vitality and longevity of our meticulously crafted hair.

Together, let's unveil the unwavering strength and grace that these protective hairstyles embody. Witness the convergence of art and necessity as the generative code meticulously replicates the artistry of skilled hairstylists, while honoring the importance of preserving and celebrating our shared heritage.

This groundbreaking project not only sparks meaningful conversations but also reflects my personal journey as a Black man and artist. Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags represents my deep passion for artistic exploration, cultural expression, and self-empowerment.

Embark on this immersive journey with me, where the du-rag becomes a symbol of empowerment and personal expression. Experience Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags: A Personal Synthesis of Protection and Timeless Style, an artistic fusion that pays homage to our collective history, celebrates individuality, and inspires a legacy of beauty."

project.name: Infinite Branches
project.description:
[ click canvas to start / stop music ]

Infinite Branches is an exploration into fully onchain generative music.

Each output is a combination of bass, chords and melodies with individualized synth sounds and visuals that creates a new branch of possibilities.

Infinite Branches explores the infinite sonics and infinite life of music created with only code and stored completely within the blockchain data.

The title has dual inspiration: the multiverse branching into countless possibilities and the concept of the CC0 tree that illustrates perpetually forked creative works into new ideas and iterations.

All music / code / artwork is in the public domain & CC0.

[ drums can be played (on pieces that have them) with 'FGHJKL' keys on the computer keyboard, 'M', 'C' and 'B' to mute melody, chords or bass ]

project.name: heart + craft
project.description:
heart + craft is an inclusive digital/physical generative collection born out of a collaboration between Erick Calderon (Snowfro) and Jordan Lyall. The project synthesizes artistic and technologically driven concepts that the two have been thinking through over the last decade as meaningful participants in both digital art and blockchain ecosystem. 

While entirely analogue examples of these heart containers have existed for many years, Erick collaborated with Jordan to automate the process of combining the blocks and colors through an algorithm that generates not only a beautiful interactive 3D model of a heart, but also includes instructions for assembling each specific output along with 3D printable models stored inside the algorithm itself. The result is an object that can live in both the physical and digital realm, inspiring the digital collector to craft their own physical sculptures and potentially creating curiosity in digital objects for those that are more grounded in the physical world. 

Learn more at [heartandcraft.xyz](https://heartandcraft.xyz/)

";

  // Create a new ArrayBuffer from the base64-encoded data
  const glbArrayBuffer = Uint8Array.from(
    atob(inlineGLBData.split(",")[1]),
    (c) => c.charCodeAt(0)
  ).buffer;

  // Use the glbArrayBuffer to load the GLB model
  const loader = new GLTFLoader();

  // Parse the glb model data and create the scene
  loader.parse(glbArrayBuffer, "", (gltf) => {
    signatureMesh = gltf.scene;
    const sc = 50;
    signatureMesh.scale.set(sc, sc / 2, sc);
    signatureMesh.rotation.set(Math.PI / 2, 0, Math.PI);
    const posY = heart == 0 ? -2.35 : -5.7;
    const posX = heart == 0 ? -0.15 : -0.15;

    signatureMesh.position.set(posX, posY, -0.05);

    signatureMesh.traverse(function (child) {
      if (child instanceof THREE.Mesh) {
        let col = new THREE.Color(
          signatureColor.rgb[0] / 255,
          signatureColor.rgb[1] / 255,
          signatureColor.rgb[2] / 255
        );
        child.material = new THREE.MeshPhysicalMaterial({
          color: col,
          metalness: 0.5,
          roughness: 0.5,
          emissive: 0.1,
        });
        // enable casting shadows
        child.castShadow = true;
        child.receiveShadow = true;
      }
    });

    // Add the model to the scene
    heartContainer.add(signatureMesh);
  });
}

project.name: heart + craft
project.description:
heart + craft is an inclusive digital/physical generative collection born out of a collaboration between Erick Calderon (Snowfro) and Jordan Lyall. The project synthesizes artistic and technologically driven concepts that the two have been thinking through over the last decade as meaningful participants in both digital art and blockchain ecosystem. 

While entirely analogue examples of these heart containers have existed for many years, Erick collaborated with Jordan to automate the process of combining the blocks and colors through an algorithm that generates not only a beautiful interactive 3D model of a heart, but also includes instructions for assembling each specific output along with 3D printable models stored inside the algorithm itself. The result is an object that can live in both the physical and digital realm, inspiring the digital collector to craft their own physical sculptures and potentially creating curiosity in digital objects for those that are more grounded in the physical world. 

Learn more at [heartandcraft.xyz](https://heartandcraft.xyz/)

project.name: heart + craft
project.description:
heart + craft is an inclusive digital/physical generative collection born out of a collaboration between Erick Calderon (Snowfro) and Jordan Lyall. The project synthesizes artistic and technologically driven concepts that the two have been thinking through over the last decade as meaningful participants in both digital art and blockchain ecosystem. 

While entirely analogue examples of these heart containers have existed for many years, Erick collaborated with Jordan to automate the process of combining the blocks and colors through an algorithm that generates not only a beautiful interactive 3D model of a heart, but also includes instructions for assembling each specific output along with 3D printable models stored inside the algorithm itself. The result is an object that can live in both the physical and digital realm, inspiring the digital collector to craft their own physical sculptures and potentially creating curiosity in digital objects for those that are more grounded in the physical world. 

Learn more at [heartandcraft.xyz](https://heartandcraft.xyz/)

project.name: Infinite Branches
project.description:
[ click canvas to start / stop music ]

Infinite Branches is an exploration into fully onchain generative music.

Each output is a combination of bass, chords and melodies with individualized synth sounds and visuals that creates a new branch of possibilities.

Infinite Branches explores the infinite sonics and infinite life of music created with only code and stored completely within the blockchain data.

The title has dual inspiration: the multiverse branching into countless possibilities and the concept of the CC0 tree that illustrates perpetually forked creative works into new ideas and iterations.

All music / code / artwork is in the public domain & CC0.

[ drums can be played (on pieces that have them) with 'FGHJKL' keys on the computer keyboard, 'M', 'C' and 'B' to mute melody, chords or bass ]

project.name: Bound by Infinity: A Cosmic Journey Beyond the Box
project.description:
From the depths of the cosmos to the mind's eye, "Bound by Infinity: A Cosmic Journey Beyond the Box" is an artistic expression of an existential paradox, co-created by James Lee of Jams2blues Creations LLC and OpenAI's ChatGPT. Together, we've designed a universe encapsulated in code, where physics, trigonometry, Euclidean geometry, and psychedelic art dance in unison within a finite cube.

James Lee's artistic vision and soulful direction met the analytical precision of ChatGPT, crafting a generative masterpiece where spheres waltz within the confines of a cube. This dance, governed by the immutable laws of physics and mathematics, mirrors our own existence in the seemingly infinite universe.

Each sphere's movement, dictated by noise-based physics, reflects the continuous pursuit of knowledge, understanding, and innovation. The boundaries of the cube, oscillating in hues, represent our current cognitive state or "box." Within these boundaries, creativity flourishes, ideas collide and rebound, yet the walls remain unyielding, symbolizing our eternal enclosure within the expansive information field of continuity.

This is not mere animation; it's a philosophical exploration, a fusion of psychedelic art and generative design. It's a visual allegory of our human journey, where we strive to think outside the box, only to find ourselves within a larger one, eternally pushing the boundaries of our understanding.

The "Bound by Infinity: A Cosmic Journey Beyond the Box" pays tribute to our relentless quest for knowledge, our symbiosis with technology, and our pursuit of originality. It reflects the essence of human curiosity, the beautiful paradox of being simultaneously confined and liberated by our own cognition.

Join us in this cosmic dance, where art therapy meets environmental consciousness. Proceeds from this NFT will support James's noble mission to uplift communities, plant trees, and champion equality, love, and mental health. Experience a symphony of colors, shapes, and motion, a dance that bends reality, and invites you to ponder the infinite nature of existence.

project.name: Mist of Memories
project.description:
"Mist of Memories" was inspired by watching smoke and thinking about how memories fade away. 
I used coding to make art that looks like smoke, and it reminds me of old times and feelings.

project.name: Reverie
project.description:
"Reverie" means a state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts; a daydream. Like the times when we are immersed in a work of art on the wall and time stops for us, Reverie is about those moments.

Reverie is a realistic exploration of abstract artworks developed entirely in code(100% code). Inspired by the artworks of abstract movement pioneers, this algorithm creates abstract artworks, just like seeing it framed on the wall.


This is a meta-art(an art inside an art), a frame in a frame that we are watching, and with this realistic style, it expresses the value we give to a piece, and the impression we make of them.


Therefore, the emphasis of this collection is on our projective perceptions of artworks, a piece of ourselves that we find in an abstract work and the value we give to it.


Various colors and styles with different frame dimensions are available in this artwork. To save the artwork, Open it in live view and press ’s’.


made with p5js.

project.name: Temples of Yore
project.description:
An exploration of pointillism through a bird's eye view of ancient temple ruins, ritual grounds and cities look like. 

Be it Angkor Wat, the Aztec sites, Hampi, or any Greco-Roman ruins, the ritualistic temples and abode of gods bear a striking resemblance when viewed from the sky.  

Maybe go looking under those ruins...and who knows what one may find under one of those sacred spaces?

project.name: Digital Mosaic
project.description:
"Digital Mosaic" creates a complex dance of shapes and colors, forming patterns that look like a digital puzzle. 
The mix of circles, rectangles, and triangles fits together in a unique way, showing both randomness and order.
It's like a painting made by a computer, using math and art together. 

The more you look, the more new patterns and surprises you find. 
It's simple but also deep and full of beauty.

project.name: Turner in the Light
project.description: This artwork is an exploration in the composition and harmony of colors to create a dynamic composition inspired by the formation of stars and stardust. Also, several form types are considered for stardusts. This artwork uses millions of small dots to shape the lights, and due to the high quality of the image, you may need enough RAM and CPU to run the animation smoothly. The preview will be captured after about a minute. Also, the file size and algorithm has been optimized for minting. Right click and save the artwork to see the real resolution and details.

project.name: Pixel Field
project.description:
Pixel Field is art inspired by Legos. 
I like how Legos can be simple pieces but make big and complex things. 

In Pixel Field, I used pixels and grids like Lego blocks to make art. 
Each pixel is like a Lego piece, and together they make something special. 
This art reminds me of playing with Legos and building something new.

project.name: Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags: A Personal Synthesis of Protection and Timeless Style
project.description:
Step into a world where resilience and artistry intertwine, where the essence of protective hairstyles converge with the timeless elegance of the humble du-rag. In this groundbreaking art project, titled Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags, I, as a Black man and artist, invite you to join me on a transformative exploration of culture, self-expression, and the enduring allure of classic style.

Immerse yourself in a tapestry of innovation as I pave the way for the first-ever on-chain generative art project featuring braids and locs. By merging the power of generative code with the rich heritage of these hairstyles, each cascading braid and meticulously crafted loc emerges as a vibrant homage to the intricate art of hair protection.

Within this digital landscape, Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags transcends the boundaries of traditional mediums, leaving an indelible mark in the world of art and technology. It celebrates the timeless relationship between style and functionality, where du-rags become essential accessories in preserving the vitality and longevity of our meticulously crafted hair.

Together, let's unveil the unwavering strength and grace that these protective hairstyles embody. Witness the convergence of art and necessity as the generative code meticulously replicates the artistry of skilled hairstylists, while honoring the importance of preserving and celebrating our shared heritage.

This groundbreaking project not only sparks meaningful conversations but also reflects my personal journey as a Black man and artist. Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags represents my deep passion for artistic exploration, cultural expression, and self-empowerment.

Embark on this immersive journey with me, where the du-rag becomes a symbol of empowerment and personal expression. Experience Beauty Supply Is Out of Du-Rags: A Personal Synthesis of Protection and Timeless Style, an artistic fusion that pays homage to our collective history, celebrates individuality, and inspires a legacy of beauty."

project.name: Focal
project.description: Focal explores a generative experience that defines clarity, in chaos.  Each output encourages the audience to relate to the fact that our minds can be very cluttered at times, but, with the practice of mindfulness, we can strive to be more aware - to focus, to think, to breathe.

Pixel Field is art inspired by Legos. 
I like how Legos can be simple pieces but make big and complex things.

This art reminds me of playing with Legos and building something new.

project.name: 集団主義
project.description:
日本の文化において、主要な概念の一つは「集団への帰属」または「社会的な繋がり」として知られる「集団依存」です。この概念は、日本社会において個人が家族、友人、同僚、または所属する他のグループに依存し、所属感を持つことを意味します。

集団への帰属は、人々の間の密接なコミュニケーションや社会的な相互作用を通じて形成され、非常に重要な役割を果たしています。この集団への帰属は、日本の生活のさまざまなレベルで見られます。例えば、家族、学校、労働組織、地域社会などです。

この集団への帰属の概念は、社会的な連帯感の確保、社会の調和とバランスの維持に役立ちます。また、この概念は、他の人々との安全な関係、保護、密接なつながりの感覚を強化し、個人的および社会的アイデンティティの形成にも重要な役割を果たすことができます。

また、階層の尊重や協力と共感の信念も、日本の集団への帰属の他の側面です。この概念は、集団の意思決定、社会的行動、人間関係の管理において非常に影響を与える可能性があります。

project.name: Spiroglyph
project.description:
From rough pen sketches to hundreds of lines of code to the digital output before you, we present "Spiroglyph"; an abstract body of work inspired by paint, texture, nature, architecture and humanity.

Through a blend of colour, scale and detail, "Spiroglypgh" takes you on a poetic algorithmic journey of unlocking the possibilities of using simple shapes to evoke creativity. Enjoy!

**NOTE: SOME OUTPUTS MAY TAKE UPTO 90 SECONDS TO FULLY RENDER**

A project by Kamau Kamau and Ian Wright

project.name: Anthill Tapestry
project.description:
"Anthill Tapestry" is a generative art project that draws inspiration from the complex and intricate structures found in ant colonies. 

    In this project, algorithms simulate the behavior of virtual ants as they navigate and interact with the canvas. Each ant carries a rectangular shape, representing a unique building block in the anthill. The canvas becomes a dynamic environment where ants meander, leaving behind trails of rectangular shapes, and collectively, they give rise to an evolving colony-like pattern.

    The artwork emphasizes the beauty of emergence, where intricate patterns and structures emerge from the collective actions of the virtual ants. It showcases how simple rules and individual behaviors can lead to complex and harmonious formations, much like the intricate tunnels and chambers found in real ant colonies.

    The shapes are not merely isolated entities; they are woven together by the threads of paths, like the bonds of a caring community. As more ants traverse the canvas, the connections between shapes grow, creating a visual representation of the interconnectedness and collaboration found in the life of a community.

project.name: Anthill Tapestry
project.description:
"Anthill Tapestry" is a generative art project that draws inspiration from the complex and intricate structures found in ant colonies. 

    In this project, algorithms simulate the behavior of virtual ants as they navigate and interact with the canvas. Each ant carries a rectangular shape, representing a unique building block in the anthill. The canvas becomes a dynamic environment where ants meander, leaving behind trails of rectangular shapes, and collectively, they give rise to an evolving colony-like pattern.

    The artwork emphasizes the beauty of emergence, where intricate patterns and structures emerge from the collective actions of the virtual ants. It showcases how simple rules and individual behaviors can lead to complex and harmonious formations, much like the intricate tunnels and chambers found in real ant colonies.

    The shapes are not merely isolated entities; they are woven together by the threads of paths, like the bonds of a caring community. As more ants traverse the canvas, the connections between shapes grow, creating a visual representation of the interconnectedness and collaboration found in the life of a community.

project.name: Virtual Bouquet
project.description:
The artwork emerged from a desire to bridge the organic beauty of nature with the precise and calculated world of digital art.
The idea blossomed as I explored the contrast between the chaotic grace of flowers and the rigid logic of mathematics and code.

I found myself captivated by the way natural elements could be translated into virtual forms.
The fractal petals represent not just the literal structures of flowers but the underlying geometries that shape our world.
By recreating these forms through code, I sought to emphasize the hidden connections between the organic and the digital, the real and the virtual.

The rotating pattern symbolizes growth and evolution, echoing the way flowers reach towards the sun.
The color palette, dynamically selected yet carefully controlled, plays with the idea of randomness within constraints, reflecting nature's own balance of chaos and order.

The piece is more than a visual artwork; it's a philosophical exploration, an ode to the unseen harmonies that unite the tangible world with the realms of imagination and technology.
It's a reminder that beauty can be found in unexpected places, even within lines of code, and that creativity is a garden that grows without bounds.

project.name: The Hashed Horizon
project.description:
This artwork is a blending of mathematics and visual beauty.
Through lines, colors, and geometric shapes, a complex pattern is created.
It's like a symphony where technology and nature come together, making a picture that feels both scientific and magical.

I was inspired by the way computers can use numbers to create things.
I learned about algorithms, which are like recipes for computers, and I thought, "Why not use them to make art?"
This artwork is my attempt to show how math and computers can be used to make something beautiful.
It's a combination of my interest in technology and my love for art.
It reminds me of the patterns in nature, like the stars or the waves in the ocean.
I wanted to capture that in a way that's new and exciting.

project.name: ikiddo
project.description:
After my recent exploration in the world of GENERATIVE NFTs, the thought crossed my mind: what if one of ZANCANs artworks is presented in the form of an animation?
That's why I decided to transform the artwork 'Kinder Garden,' a collaborative creation by the renowned artists Yazid and Zancan, into an animation.
I have used P5.js to create this project. My strong recommendation is to save the image and then thoroughly analyze the details incorporated into the project.

project.name: ikiddo
project.description:
After my recent exploration in the world of GENERATIVE NFTs, the thought crossed my mind: what if one of ZANCANs artworks is presented in the form of an animation?
That's why I decided to transform the artwork 'Kinder Garden,' a collaborative creation by the renowned artists Yazid and Zancan, into an animation.
I have used P5.js to create this project. My strong recommendation is to save the image and then thoroughly analyze the details incorporated into the project.

project.name: Squares Symphony
project.description:
In a digital world filled with complexity, a simple geometric shape caught my eye. It was pure, yet profound, and it whispered a secret.
I began to explore, using unique hashes to guide my brush, and discovered a hidden landscape of patterns and connections. Each shape became a character in a story, each line a path to follow.
This artwork is that story, a tale of simplicity meeting complexity, told through the universal language of shapes and colors.

project.name: Pig's Tail
project.description:
Life moves in non-linear ways, looping back on itself unpredictably from time to time. This genesis project is an exploration in representing a life's pig-tail-like pattern, seeing the outputs and wondering what kind of life would have lived that pattern.

Pig's Tail uses flow fields and randomness as the pig's tail is formed, which, like life, can take unexpected turns.

project.name: Electric Love
project.description:
This generative artwork crafts pulsating patterns and colors, reflecting the dynamic energy of connection and emotion. 

Inspired by the fusion of technology with organic warmth, the deterministic algorithm creates unique yet reproducible visuals. 
The blend of digital precision with affection led to the creation of this piece.

project.name: Ge0metric Origamix
project.description:
Ge0metric Origamix takes inspiration from the ancient art of origami and infuses it with geometric precision. The artwork showcases a grid of triangles, 

arranged and rotated in a pattern that mirrors the folding technique used in origami.

project.name: 夏の真昼
project.description: 夏の真昼の太陽が街を覆い、私は思い出を忘れようとしてさまよっていた

project.name: Crowded City
project.description:
This art project manifests the essence of urban landscapes. 
through abstract representation, it encapsulates the vibrancy and melancholy inherent in densely populated cities.


it's an emotional commentary on modern urban existence.
The combination of abstract buildings and the sad red moon evokes feelings of both excitement and solitude, mirroring the dual nature of city life.

project.name: Chromatic Vortex
project.description: Step right up and witness a dazzling dance of colors, where particles whirl and twirl in a mesmerizing vortex, all created by a code that's nothing short of a visual jackpot!

project.name: NeoGem
project.description:
I always like shiny things like gems and crystals. 
I see them in stores and nature, and they make me feel happy and curious.
I want to make something like that but in my own way. 
So I use computer to make NeoGem. 
It's like I can have my own gems, but they are special and different. 
I'm proud of it and hope people like to look at it.

project.name: Wormhole
project.description:
If I could go through a wormhole, I would go back to the first time I saw her, to the first time I experienced love in my heart...

Humans are able to understand and experience more than 250 different types of emotions. And emotions shape our memory. There is a wormhole in the heart of every person that can travel through time, and the means of this journey is to accurately recall the emotions that we have experienced in the past and at a specific time...

“The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart” 
― Helen Keller

The shape of emotions
Who can say what a person's longing shapes? Or what exactly is the image of love?
Sometimes we can hardly describe our feelings.
I used irregular shapes to show 246 different types of emotions and offered each of them a specific color.

project.name: Det Occult
project.description:
A procedural, generative art PFP made with 100% code. Profile pictures are purely for fun, but I did make an attempt to try and add some nuance to these. We tend to hide our imperfections, whiten our teeth and straighten them out for example, in order to show a more "perfect" version of ourselves to society - but I thought these characters should show a more true picture of us. Blockchain siblings of the Das Occult -> https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/slug/gen-xyz-das-occult (https://twitter.com/dasoccult) created by Todd McCullough AKA Culla (https://twitter.com/tamccullough) (https://www.duub.ca)
r - run animation 
p - pause animation 
c - generative cover art (not animated) 
m - return to pfp
i - feature info box when running animated mode 
s - save the image on screen at current window resolution

Blockchain siblings of the Das Occult -> https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/slug/gen-xyz-das-occult (https://twitter.com/dasoccult) created by Todd McCullough AKA Culla (https://twitter.com/tamccullough) (https://www.duub.ca)
r - run animation 
p - pause animation 
c - generative cover art (not animated) 
m - return to pfp
i - feature info box when running animated mode 
s - save the image on screen at current window resolution

project.name: Camouflage
project.description: A window into some sort of landscape. Grapes on a vine. Oil spills through a reef. Australian bushfires. A reflection of digital war. The simplicity of expression.

project.name: EverSpring
project.description:
Spring came late this year to this part of the world, and it lasted longer than it used to. Endless rains and fresh spring winds nurtured the nature to the extent that it decorated everywhere with a beauty it has never displayed before.

EverSpring is not a work of design; it appeared by itself while working on an algorithm of mine. Constantly hearing the birds' cheerful songs, smelling the varicolored spring flowers and relaxing in the warmth of the Sun, I continued to develop this concept which made me feel even more spring-like.

It was a joy working on EverSpring, but no matter how hard I tried, the algorithm wouldn't let me achieve any other variations as beautiful as the ones I used. As if, it wanted to stay the way it was ever meant to be. Hence, once reaching the form that satisfied me visually, I focused on the beauty and harmony of colors, as it is in unmatchable finesse in the nature itself.

I prepared 18 color palettes for EverSpring, each with 5 main and 5 shade colors. I named them after spring flowers, not necessarily based on how they look or what color they are. Because this spring, all flowers and all colors were merged together in a never-before-seen harmony.

I hope that you will like EverSpring as much as I enjoyed working on it. And I wish you a life as beautiful, as colorful and as peaceful as an everlasting spring.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG. To save a larger image, open live view, add "&s=WIDTH_IN_PIXELS" to the end of the URL (e.g. "&s=1800"), press Enter and then press S.

Artwork by yenren

https://yenren.art/
https://twitter.com/yenrenART

NFT License 2.0 / CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

#generativeart #genart #nature #spring #flowers

project.name: TIMELINES
project.description:
For as long as humans have been scientists, thinkers, philosophers and artists, they have exhibited and documented a fascination with time. Time may be measured to be linear but the experience may not always be so.

‘Timelines’ is a live animated generative art piece that goes beyond utility to deliver an experience of the passage of time as a feeling.

The piece draws itself based on the current time of the day. The hour() decides the number of horizontal rows, the minute() decides the number of vertical lines in each row.

project.name: Fwenly Fields
project.description:
These happy little fields are always looking to make new friends around them.
I hope they can be your friends too!

This is the second phase of "Fwenly Fields". 
The first part was minted on fxHash (https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/28443)

Unminted tokens were burnt and the remaining tokens were minted on Prohibition.art.

project.name: Link
project.description: This artwork is based on Truchet tiles with simple animation.

project.name: Strips
project.description:
Weaves the fabric of the cosmos into bands of color and form.
Each strip, a breath of the universe, oscillates between harmony and chaos.
With every render, the artwork captures a unique yet eternal moment,
As if whispering secrets from the realm of the abstract into our souls.

project.name: Astro Vortex
project.description:
Astro Vortex feels like staring into the eye of the universe, and it's awe-inspiring.
When you look at it, you're caught in a swirl of light and color that seems to pull you towards some unknown but magnetic center.
It's like a cosmic whirlpool, drawing you in while radiating energy outward in loops and spirals.
For a moment, you're not just looking at art; you're glimpsing the intricate dance of celestial bodies and the magnetic pull of something greater.
It's a reminder of how small we are, yet how connected everything is in the grand tapestry of the cosmos.

project.name: Fractured DNA
project.description: a generative art piece that captures the complexity and unpredictability of genetic structures through a mesmerizing array of colorful, rotating circles.

project.name: Harmony of Insight
project.description:
Step into my device,
Where we gather, precise.
Each emotion, notion, my essence unfurls,
From every inch, my existence swirls.

project.name: My Block Island
project.description: Generative Multiverse Island with different resources

project.name: Canvas of Night
project.description:
In the blackened shroud of night,
A mountain rises in silent might.
Moon's soft glow, a beacon bright,
Casting shadows, a monochrome sight.

Silhouette against the starry sky,
Majestic peak, reaching high.
Moonlight dances on rocky steep,
A tranquil secret, the night keeps.

Cool breeze whispers through the trees,
Echoes of silence, a gentle tease.
Mountain's embrace, a stoic form,
Moon's allure, a celestial norm.

Black canvas painted with moonlit grace,
A serene landscape to embrace.
Nature's theater, night's grand boon,
Mountain, moon, and black commune.

project.name: The Meat Sweats In Memphis
project.description:
On a trip to Memphis, I visited a Brazilian Steakhouse for the first time. I was not prepared for the parade of meats to come. The steak, lamb, bison, grilled pineapple, pork, and even chicken hearts were all delicious. The servers do not stop the offerings until you flip your indicator to show you have had enough. It is hard to say no to the cavalcade of meat swords. It was glorious.

Then comes the moment in life where somehow the good you were caught up in takes a turn for the worse. I started to sweat. My breath felt labored and my stomach was angry. It almost felt like I was hallucinating. And that was the time that I got The Meat Sweats In Memphis. 

There is a twisted beauty in the pieces with a mild hallucinogenic feel. Visuals of labored breath movement, heartburn, and variations of sweat are interspersed with the memory of the delicious meal. You may have never had the meat sweats, but I am sure there are pointed times in your life that connect with this moment.

This collection explores the emotional experience of a good thing transforming into something undesirable. This transition generates a swirl of emotions, a blend of shock, disappointment, confusion, and despair. The experience of being engaged in a tug of war between the reminiscence of what once was and the reality of the present. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of experiences and expectations, leading to introspection about the dynamics of good and bad in our lives.

Also ... I really want to hear you say that you got The Meat Sweats In Memphis.

project.name: Don't Hash && Dash
project.description: Introducing 'Don't Hash && Dash', the crowning achievement of a four-part series at the intersection of technology, art, and blockchain. This collection is a testament to the limitless potential of generative art when paired with the immutable ledger of blockchain technology. This final chapter closes the story told by 'Hash && Dash', 'Hash && Dash Origins', and 'Hash && Dot', each exploring the intersection of creativity and the decentralized world.

project.name: Dizzy Wheel
project.description:
Stare at the wheel's center for 30 seconds. 
Blink at a white wall. 
You'll see the essence of the artwork.

Warning: Content may trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy. 
Viewer discretion advised.

project.name: Subdivision Paradise
project.description:
Subdivision Paradise celebrates basic forms, using clear-cut criteria to determine when to split a section.

The artwork thrives on the harmony between minimalism and complexity, as each subdivision adds a new layer of depth. 
The whole piece serves as an evolving canvas, where simple shapes collectively form intricate patterns.

project.name: Robots
project.description: This long-form generative art is a reflection on the future of artificial intelligence and humans. It is a meditation on the brains of intelligent machines. Their neural networks. Their synapses. It is also a reflection on the possibilities and challenges of the new relationship between intelligent machines and humans. The dilemmas. The apprehension. The openness. What does it mean to be human in a world where machines are becoming increasingly intelligent? The future is not set in stone.

project.name: Skewed Cuboids
project.description:
Skewed Cuboids is a dynamic digital art piece that splashes your screen with extending 3D shapes, all radiating from a central axis. 
Every view offers a unique but balanced arrangement of colors and forms, turning your screen into a portal to a kaleidoscopic world.

project.name: Pixel Perfect Moments
project.description:
Discover a fresh perspective on time with this collection of generative art clocks. 

Use the right-click menu to access controls where you can customize the display.

Pixel Perfect Moments features a minimalist mosaic of pixels as the backdrop of a dynamic clock that displays correctly for the observer.

Open the piece in a new window and the right-click menu (or double-tap on touch devices) contains the full set of controls including options to download different sized images.

project.name: Pixel Perfect Moments
project.description:
Discover a fresh perspective on time with this collection of generative art clocks. 

Use the right-click menu to access controls where you can customize the display.

Pixel Perfect Moments features a minimalist mosaic of pixels as the backdrop of a dynamic clock that displays correctly for the observer.

Open the piece in a new window and the right-click menu (or double-tap on touch devices) contains the full set of controls including options to download different sized images.

project.name: Pixel Perfect Moments
project.description:
Discover a fresh perspective on time with this collection of generative art clocks. 

Use the right-click menu to access controls where you can customize the display.

Pixel Perfect Moments features a minimalist mosaic of pixels as the backdrop of a dynamic clock that displays correctly for the observer.

Open the piece in a new window and the right-click menu (or double-tap on touch devices) contains the full set of controls including options to download different sized images.

project.name: Montañas
project.description:
Mountains awaken, night sky's allure,
Coded artistry, a creation pure.
Abstract forms, pixels entwine,
A digital artwork, Coded and designed.
------------------------------------------------
In lofty realms where shadows dwell,
A tale of Montañas I shall tell,
With echoes haunting, dark and deep,
Where secrets wake from eternal sleep.

Beneath the moon's cold, watchful gaze,
Montañas rise in a ghostly haze,
Their jagged peaks pierce the night,
Bathed in the pale, unearthly light.

Amidst the mist and swirling fog,
Whispers of legends, like a mournful slog,
A raven soars with a chilling cry,
A harbinger of tales that never die.

Within these mountains, eerie and grand,
A realm of darkness, a forbidden land,
Where ancient spirits roam untamed,
And phantoms whisper the names of the famed.

In hidden caves and caverns deep,
Lost souls wander, their secrets keep,
Their restless spirits forever bound,
To Montañas' dark and haunted ground.

The wind howls through the narrow pass,
A mournful wail, like shards of glass,
As twilight fades and darkness falls,
An eerie silence befalls the walls.

Beware the abyss, the depths unknown,
Where madness lurks and fears are sown,
For Montañas hold a sinister might,
A treacherous beauty, an endless night.

In moonlit trails and starlit skies,
Where shadows dance and secrets lie,
Montañas' allure, a siren's call,
To those who dare to venture all.

But heed my words, dear traveler brave,
For Montañas guard an untamed grave,
Where dreams may perish, and souls may weep,
In the dark embrace of Montañas' keep.

Embrace the allure, the soul's retreat,
Let Montañas' essence make you complete,
For like a masterpiece, forever preserved,
In Montañas' embrace, your spirit is stirred.

project.name: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက
project.description:
​℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is about identity; both individual identity as well as our collective identity as a species.

Since the very beginning, human beings have been fascinated by the world around them. We have tried to understand it, our place in it, and ourselves. In this process, faced with chaotic complexity and forces we couldn't comprehend, we gave significance to otherwise meaningless events, and created a meaningful world for ourselves within the greater unfathomable universe. 

Things do not have names, nor exist in inherent categories. Humans are responsible for these... We are the inventors of meaning.

With this in mind, I present my own creation: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက

I'm a single human, attempting to be humanity itself in my own analogy, with my creation as a metaphor for all we have created.

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is an ever-evolving artwork that focuses on the experience of existing as a human being; our grappling with the apparent chaos we find ourselves in and our constant attempts at finding order and meaning in this chaos.

And just like our lives, there are random, meaningless elements in it, there are deliberate, purposeful elements in it, and there are elements that depend on your interpretation as to whether they have any meaning or not. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက asks you: Do things have inherent meaning, or are they empty of it until human beings consider them worthy of consideration? And it dares you to find meaning for your own life in it.

Thus, when you look at your ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, you will have questions about the meaning of its elements, just as we have questions about the meaning of everything we experience, including our own existence. And while all the answers to the latter might not ever be fully understood, the answers to the former can be found with the help of one of humanity's greatest modern inventions: the internet. Whether this then goes on to help you find meaning in your own life is up to you.

Any attempt at describing ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက without mentioning Matt Kane's "Gazers" would be incomplete. In both a literal and figurative sense, Gazers are what gave birth to ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက. Literally, because it was while reading the art description of Gazers that the idea for ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက came to me. Figuratively, because if Gazers represent any one thing at all, that thing is nature, while ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက represents humans and their experiences. And through evolution by natural selection, humans were born from, and are a part of, nature.

It could be said that ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a kind of mirrored-reflection of Gazers. It focuses on and celebrates general subjective human learning and perception of reality, while Gazers' weave a delightful tapestry of light and time of which we humans partake of as entranced observers. 

Gazers ask questions about the future based upon observations of the past, and evolve according to specific rhythms in nature, using deterministic design rules upon their creation to determine all future evolution. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, on the other hand, asks no questions about the future, but rather focuses exclusively on the present, and how it has been influenced by the past. It asks, "How is today important?"

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက's evolution is inspired by the lives of humans, as well as by the arbitrary, irregular clock of that which humans give importance to. Thus its deterministic design rules give the illusion of random evolution, as well as celebrate sporadic points in time determined beforehand, mimicking how human lives seem to progress chaotically except for certain moments in our lives that feel like "destiny". 

These moments only seem this way, however, with hindsight - when we look back, see our own personal story, and try to make sense of it. In the same way, ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက will change according to celebrated dates in the past from the date they were created, regardless of whether those days continue to be recognised or remembered in the future.

This pseudo-random evolution is also meant to be an analogy for compatibilism when it comes to free will. Compatibilism says that even though everything, past and future, is all predetermined, we can still act with free agency in what we perceive as the present moment. In the same way, all the randomness of the colours, characters and positionings of the characters of ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက are hard-coded in. But when actually looking at the work in the present, all these elements seem to change randomly.

In the end, humans and their culture all still fall under the great umbrella that is nature/the natural world. As much as our ancestors tried to deny it, we are as much a part of nature as the lowliest slimes - we just follow different rhythms, and at its core, this is what ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a celebration of: The wonderful fact of our existence as a result of simple, natural processes in the natural world, and our unique complexity that is so remarkable as to fool itself (ourselves) into thinking that we're something apart.

​For information about what each element in ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက symbolises, visit : mandelsage.com/eye-am

project.name: Fluxograph
project.description:
Noise in the mix, for a touch of chaos,
Pallete's so hot, ain't no color loss.
Spring and friction, yea they in the fray,
Balancin' forces, they don't play.

© genix | aug 2023

V=[9,11,"✨🔭🪐🎓🌎","🌌👽👾","🟨🛰️📀",["Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.","Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.","One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.","If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.","Books break the shackles of time. A book is proof that humans are capable of working magic.","For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.","Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.","For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.","The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.","Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were, but without it we go nowhere.","We are like butterflies who flutter for a day and think it is forever.","The universe is a pretty big place. If it's just us, seems like an awful waste of space.","As much as I want to believe that when I die I will live again, I know of nothing to suggest that this is more than wishful thinking.","Exploration is in our nature. We have lingered long enough on the shores of the cosmic ocean. project.name: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက
project.description:
​℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is about identity; both individual identity as well as our collective identity as a species.

Since the very beginning, human beings have been fascinated by the world around them. We have tried to understand it, our place in it, and ourselves. In this process, faced with chaotic complexity and forces we couldn't comprehend, we gave significance to otherwise meaningless events, and created a meaningful world for ourselves within the greater unfathomable universe. 

Things do not have names, nor exist in inherent categories. Humans are responsible for these... We are the inventors of meaning.

With this in mind, I present my own creation: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက

I'm a single human, attempting to be humanity itself in my own analogy, with my creation as a metaphor for all we have created.

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is an ever-evolving artwork that focuses on the experience of existing as a human being; our grappling with the apparent chaos we find ourselves in and our constant attempts at finding order and meaning in this chaos.

And just like our lives, there are random, meaningless elements in it, there are deliberate, purposeful elements in it, and there are elements that depend on your interpretation as to whether they have any meaning or not. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက asks you: Do things have inherent meaning, or are they empty of it until human beings consider them worthy of consideration? And it dares you to find meaning for your own life in it.

Thus, when you look at your ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, you will have questions about the meaning of its elements, just as we have questions about the meaning of everything we experience, including our own existence. And while all the answers to the latter might not ever be fully understood, the answers to the former can be found with the help of one of humanity's greatest modern inventions: the internet. Whether this then goes on to help you find meaning in your own life is up to you.

Any attempt at describing ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက without mentioning Matt Kane's "Gazers" would be incomplete. In both a literal and figurative sense, Gazers are what gave birth to ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက. Literally, because it was while reading the art description of Gazers that the idea for ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက came to me. Figuratively, because if Gazers represent any one thing at all, that thing is nature, while ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက represents humans and their experiences. And through evolution by natural selection, humans were born from, and are a part of, nature.

It could be said that ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a kind of mirrored-reflection of Gazers. It focuses on and celebrates general subjective human learning and perception of reality, while Gazers' weave a delightful tapestry of light and time of which we humans partake of as entranced observers. 

Gazers ask questions about the future based upon observations of the past, and evolve according to specific rhythms in nature, using deterministic design rules upon their creation to determine all future evolution. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, on the other hand, asks no questions about the future, but rather focuses exclusively on the present, and how it has been influenced by the past. It asks, "How is today important?"

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက's evolution is inspired by the lives of humans, as well as by the arbitrary, irregular clock of that which humans give importance to. Thus its deterministic design rules give the illusion of random evolution, as well as celebrate sporadic points in time determined beforehand, mimicking how human lives seem to progress chaotically except for certain moments in our lives that feel like "destiny". 

These moments only seem this way, however, with hindsight - when we look back, see our own personal story, and try to make sense of it. In the same way, ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက will change according to celebrated dates in the past from the date they were created, regardless of whether those days continue to be recognised or remembered in the future.

This pseudo-random evolution is also meant to be an analogy for compatibilism when it comes to free will. Compatibilism says that even though everything, past and future, is all predetermined, we can still act with free agency in what we perceive as the present moment. In the same way, all the randomness of the colours, characters and positionings of the characters of ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက are hard-coded in. But when actually looking at the work in the present, all these elements seem to change randomly.

In the end, humans and their culture all still fall under the great umbrella that is nature/the natural world. As much as our ancestors tried to deny it, we are as much a part of nature as the lowliest slimes - we just follow different rhythms, and at its core, this is what ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a celebration of: The wonderful fact of our existence as a result of simple, natural processes in the natural world, and our unique complexity that is so remarkable as to fool itself (ourselves) into thinking that we're something apart.

​For information about what each element in ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက symbolises, visit : mandelsage.com/eye-am

Backgrounds based on the Earthbound and Mother series from Nintendo.

Basically consists on a grid changing his color with palette cycling and adding a sine movement on the X and Y axis.

project.name: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက
project.description:
​℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is about identity; both individual identity as well as our collective identity as a species.

Since the very beginning, human beings have been fascinated by the world around them. We have tried to understand it, our place in it, and ourselves. In this process, faced with chaotic complexity and forces we couldn't comprehend, we gave significance to otherwise meaningless events, and created a meaningful world for ourselves within the greater unfathomable universe. 

Things do not have names, nor exist in inherent categories. Humans are responsible for these... We are the inventors of meaning.

With this in mind, I present my own creation: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက

I'm a single human, attempting to be humanity itself in my own analogy, with my creation as a metaphor for all we have created.

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is an ever-evolving artwork that focuses on the experience of existing as a human being; our grappling with the apparent chaos we find ourselves in and our constant attempts at finding order and meaning in this chaos.

And just like our lives, there are random, meaningless elements in it, there are deliberate, purposeful elements in it, and there are elements that depend on your interpretation as to whether they have any meaning or not. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက asks you: Do things have inherent meaning, or are they empty of it until human beings consider them worthy of consideration? And it dares you to find meaning for your own life in it.

Thus, when you look at your ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, you will have questions about the meaning of its elements, just as we have questions about the meaning of everything we experience, including our own existence. And while all the answers to the latter might not ever be fully understood, the answers to the former can be found with the help of one of humanity's greatest modern inventions: the internet. Whether this then goes on to help you find meaning in your own life is up to you.

Any attempt at describing ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက without mentioning Matt Kane's "Gazers" would be incomplete. In both a literal and figurative sense, Gazers are what gave birth to ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက. Literally, because it was while reading the art description of Gazers that the idea for ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက came to me. Figuratively, because if Gazers represent any one thing at all, that thing is nature, while ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက represents humans and their experiences. And through evolution by natural selection, humans were born from, and are a part of, nature.

It could be said that ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a kind of mirrored-reflection of Gazers. It focuses on and celebrates general subjective human learning and perception of reality, while Gazers' weave a delightful tapestry of light and time of which we humans partake of as entranced observers. 

Gazers ask questions about the future based upon observations of the past, and evolve according to specific rhythms in nature, using deterministic design rules upon their creation to determine all future evolution. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, on the other hand, asks no questions about the future, but rather focuses exclusively on the present, and how it has been influenced by the past. It asks, "How is today important?"

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက's evolution is inspired by the lives of humans, as well as by the arbitrary, irregular clock of that which humans give importance to. Thus its deterministic design rules give the illusion of random evolution, as well as celebrate sporadic points in time determined beforehand, mimicking how human lives seem to progress chaotically except for certain moments in our lives that feel like "destiny". 

These moments only seem this way, however, with hindsight - when we look back, see our own personal story, and try to make sense of it. In the same way, ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက will change according to celebrated dates in the past from the date they were created, regardless of whether those days continue to be recognised or remembered in the future.

This pseudo-random evolution is also meant to be an analogy for compatibilism when it comes to free will. Compatibilism says that even though everything, past and future, is all predetermined, we can still act with free agency in what we perceive as the present moment. In the same way, all the randomness of the colours, characters and positionings of the characters of ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက are hard-coded in. But when actually looking at the work in the present, all these elements seem to change randomly.

In the end, humans and their culture all still fall under the great umbrella that is nature/the natural world. As much as our ancestors tried to deny it, we are as much a part of nature as the lowliest slimes - we just follow different rhythms, and at its core, this is what ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a celebration of: The wonderful fact of our existence as a result of simple, natural processes in the natural world, and our unique complexity that is so remarkable as to fool itself (ourselves) into thinking that we're something apart.

​For information about what each element in ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက symbolises, visit : mandelsage.com/eye-am

project.name: Virtuocity Connectible
project.description:
A geometric playground, and man, do the basic shapes have a starring role here.

We're talking about raw vertices coming together to form polygons, which are essentially the building blocks of this entire digital universe.

You thought squares and triangles were basic? Think again.

Here, they're the VIPs, the backbone of the aesthetic.

project.name: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက
project.description:
​℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is about identity; both individual identity as well as our collective identity as a species.

Since the very beginning, human beings have been fascinated by the world around them. We have tried to understand it, our place in it, and ourselves. In this process, faced with chaotic complexity and forces we couldn't comprehend, we gave significance to otherwise meaningless events, and created a meaningful world for ourselves within the greater unfathomable universe. 

Things do not have names, nor exist in inherent categories. Humans are responsible for these... We are the inventors of meaning.

With this in mind, I present my own creation: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက

I'm a single human, attempting to be humanity itself in my own analogy, with my creation as a metaphor for all we have created.

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is an ever-evolving artwork that focuses on the experience of existing as a human being; our grappling with the apparent chaos we find ourselves in and our constant attempts at finding order and meaning in this chaos.

And just like our lives, there are random, meaningless elements in it, there are deliberate, purposeful elements in it, and there are elements that depend on your interpretation as to whether they have any meaning or not. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက asks you: Do things have inherent meaning, or are they empty of it until human beings consider them worthy of consideration? And it dares you to find meaning for your own life in it.

Thus, when you look at your ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, you will have questions about the meaning of its elements, just as we have questions about the meaning of everything we experience, including our own existence. And while all the answers to the latter might not ever be fully understood, the answers to the former can be found with the help of one of humanity's greatest modern inventions: the internet. Whether this then goes on to help you find meaning in your own life is up to you.

Any attempt at describing ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက without mentioning Matt Kane's "Gazers" would be incomplete. In both a literal and figurative sense, Gazers are what gave birth to ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက. Literally, because it was while reading the art description of Gazers that the idea for ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက came to me. Figuratively, because if Gazers represent any one thing at all, that thing is nature, while ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက represents humans and their experiences. And through evolution by natural selection, humans were born from, and are a part of, nature.

It could be said that ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a kind of mirrored-reflection of Gazers. It focuses on and celebrates general subjective human learning and perception of reality, while Gazers' weave a delightful tapestry of light and time of which we humans partake of as entranced observers. 

Gazers ask questions about the future based upon observations of the past, and evolve according to specific rhythms in nature, using deterministic design rules upon their creation to determine all future evolution. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, on the other hand, asks no questions about the future, but rather focuses exclusively on the present, and how it has been influenced by the past. It asks, "How is today important?"

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက's evolution is inspired by the lives of humans, as well as by the arbitrary, irregular clock of that which humans give importance to. Thus its deterministic design rules give the illusion of random evolution, as well as celebrate sporadic points in time determined beforehand, mimicking how human lives seem to progress chaotically except for certain moments in our lives that feel like "destiny". 

These moments only seem this way, however, with hindsight - when we look back, see our own personal story, and try to make sense of it. In the same way, ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက will change according to celebrated dates in the past from the date they were created, regardless of whether those days continue to be recognised or remembered in the future.

This pseudo-random evolution is also meant to be an analogy for compatibilism when it comes to free will. Compatibilism says that even though everything, past and future, is all predetermined, we can still act with free agency in what we perceive as the present moment. In the same way, all the randomness of the colours, characters and positionings of the characters of ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက are hard-coded in. But when actually looking at the work in the present, all these elements seem to change randomly.

In the end, humans and their culture all still fall under the great umbrella that is nature/the natural world. As much as our ancestors tried to deny it, we are as much a part of nature as the lowliest slimes - we just follow different rhythms, and at its core, this is what ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a celebration of: The wonderful fact of our existence as a result of simple, natural processes in the natural world, and our unique complexity that is so remarkable as to fool itself (ourselves) into thinking that we're something apart.

​For information about what each element in ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက symbolises, visit : mandelsage.com/eye-am

project.name: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက
project.description:
​℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is about identity; both individual identity as well as our collective identity as a species.

Since the very beginning, human beings have been fascinated by the world around them. We have tried to understand it, our place in it, and ourselves. In this process, faced with chaotic complexity and forces we couldn't comprehend, we gave significance to otherwise meaningless events, and created a meaningful world for ourselves within the greater unfathomable universe. 

Things do not have names, nor exist in inherent categories. Humans are responsible for these... We are the inventors of meaning.

With this in mind, I present my own creation: ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက

I'm a single human, attempting to be humanity itself in my own analogy, with my creation as a metaphor for all we have created.

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is an ever-evolving artwork that focuses on the experience of existing as a human being; our grappling with the apparent chaos we find ourselves in and our constant attempts at finding order and meaning in this chaos.

And just like our lives, there are random, meaningless elements in it, there are deliberate, purposeful elements in it, and there are elements that depend on your interpretation as to whether they have any meaning or not. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက asks you: Do things have inherent meaning, or are they empty of it until human beings consider them worthy of consideration? And it dares you to find meaning for your own life in it.

Thus, when you look at your ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, you will have questions about the meaning of its elements, just as we have questions about the meaning of everything we experience, including our own existence. And while all the answers to the latter might not ever be fully understood, the answers to the former can be found with the help of one of humanity's greatest modern inventions: the internet. Whether this then goes on to help you find meaning in your own life is up to you.

Any attempt at describing ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက without mentioning Matt Kane's "Gazers" would be incomplete. In both a literal and figurative sense, Gazers are what gave birth to ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက. Literally, because it was while reading the art description of Gazers that the idea for ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက came to me. Figuratively, because if Gazers represent any one thing at all, that thing is nature, while ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက represents humans and their experiences. And through evolution by natural selection, humans were born from, and are a part of, nature.

It could be said that ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a kind of mirrored-reflection of Gazers. It focuses on and celebrates general subjective human learning and perception of reality, while Gazers' weave a delightful tapestry of light and time of which we humans partake of as entranced observers. 

Gazers ask questions about the future based upon observations of the past, and evolve according to specific rhythms in nature, using deterministic design rules upon their creation to determine all future evolution. ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက, on the other hand, asks no questions about the future, but rather focuses exclusively on the present, and how it has been influenced by the past. It asks, "How is today important?"

℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက's evolution is inspired by the lives of humans, as well as by the arbitrary, irregular clock of that which humans give importance to. Thus its deterministic design rules give the illusion of random evolution, as well as celebrate sporadic points in time determined beforehand, mimicking how human lives seem to progress chaotically except for certain moments in our lives that feel like "destiny". 

These moments only seem this way, however, with hindsight - when we look back, see our own personal story, and try to make sense of it. In the same way, ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက will change according to celebrated dates in the past from the date they were created, regardless of whether those days continue to be recognised or remembered in the future.

This pseudo-random evolution is also meant to be an analogy for compatibilism when it comes to free will. Compatibilism says that even though everything, past and future, is all predetermined, we can still act with free agency in what we perceive as the present moment. In the same way, all the randomness of the colours, characters and positionings of the characters of ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက are hard-coded in. But when actually looking at the work in the present, all these elements seem to change randomly.

In the end, humans and their culture all still fall under the great umbrella that is nature/the natural world. As much as our ancestors tried to deny it, we are as much a part of nature as the lowliest slimes - we just follow different rhythms, and at its core, this is what ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက is a celebration of: The wonderful fact of our existence as a result of simple, natural processes in the natural world, and our unique complexity that is so remarkable as to fool itself (ourselves) into thinking that we're something apart.

​For information about what each element in ℈ℽ⍷-ᚤက symbolises, visit : mandelsage.com/eye-am

project.name: La sabbia e il mare
project.description:
"La sabbia e il mare" è una straordinaria collezione di 50 opere d'arte generativa che catturano l'essenza unica del mare e della sabbia attraverso innovative tecniche algoritmiche. Queste opere sono il risultato di una magistrale fusione di matematica e creatività, che si traduce in una straordinaria esperienza visiva.
—
Ogni opera consiste in un insieme di particelle che si muovono in modo apparentemente casuale ma strutturato su uno sfondo bianco, che ricorda una tela bianca in attesa del tocco dell'artista. Le particelle si muovono con grazia e fluidità, creando un senso di moto perpetuo, proprio come le onde che si infrangono sulla sabbia dorata di una spiaggia incontaminata.
—
La palette di colori utilizzata in questa collezione è altrettanto accattivante. Il blu profondo e l'arancione vibrante si fondono delicatamente, evocando il riflesso del sole sull'acqua e le sfumature sempre diverse del cielo al tramonto. Questi colori si fondono e si sovrappongono in modo da conferire alle opere una sensazione di calma e serenità.
—
Ogni opera è unica, ma tutte condividono una qualità ipnotica che cattura lo spettatore e lo trasporta in un mondo di bellezza astratta. Il numero di particelle in movimento e le loro posizioni cambiano costantemente, creando un senso di evoluzione e alterazione, simile a quello delle maree che si alzano e si abbassano lungo la riva.
—
L'artista ha abilmente sfruttato l'algoritmo per catturare la magia e la complessità del mare e della sabbia, creando opere che sembrano prendere vita. Osservando queste opere, si può quasi sentire il rumore delle onde che si infrangono e il calore del sole sulla pelle.
—
"La sabbia e il mare" è una collezione che invita gli spettatori a riflettere sulla bellezza della natura e sulla sua incommensurabile importanza. Queste opere d'arte generative ci ricordano quanto sia prezioso il nostro pianeta e ci ispirano a preservare e proteggere gli ecosistemi costieri e marini. In definitiva, questa collezione è un tributo alla meraviglia della natura e una celebrazione dell'arte generativa come mezzo per esplorare la bellezza e l'intricatezza del mondo che ci circonda.

project.name: Nyan Noise
project.description:
So you've heard of white noise? or maybe brown noise? could I interest you in Nyan Noise? 

A single frequency will be generated. From that frequency 2 more will be calculated and a chord formed. From the chord a progression will be created mathematically. The initial frequency is random... there is no mapping to the western ear outside of the intervals between chords. Each chord will be played for a random duration, complimented by 2 entirely random low end frequencies. The visual layer is composed via mathematically translating the frequencies to colors to generate a color pallet. There are two strokes that are shaped after the chord and low end frequencies that paint the canvas the duration of a chord. There are 2 filters layered on top which move relative to the "rhythm" of the chords. The outputs are not musical in any nature. They are noise... There is a refrain created between the color and sounds that aim to draw you in and induce catharsis via hyperstimulation. I find myself staring at multiple outputs per code iteration. I hope that others can block out the world for a moment and be present with these pieces in a meditative way.
